data.title: Far right threatens stability of Spain, says former PM José María Aznar
data.meta_description: The rise of the far right poses a serious threat to Spain even as it faces “a permanent coup d’état” in Catalonia and an economic downturn, José María Aznar, a former prime minister, warned yesterday.In an interview with The Times, the centre-right leader, who served two terms between 1996 and 2004,
data.text:
The rise of the far right poses a serious threat to Spain even as it faces “a permanent coup d’état” in Catalonia and an economic downturn, José María Aznar, a former prime minister, warned yesterday.

In an interview with The Times, the centre-right leader, who served two terms between 1996 and 2004, said that the general election to be held on Sunday risked aggravating Spain’s worst political crisis in decades.

This will be the fourth election in four years, with none of the preceding ones able to produce a mandate for a stable government — the result of the nation’s fragmenting political system in the past decade.
